[b] Dead by Daylight [/b] is a [b] Great Overall Game [/b]! I've played on mobile, console, and PC.  Cross play means better que times and ability to play with friends cross console. Team up with you best buddies and survive together! Alternately [strike] jealous [/strike] that none of you best buds are on ? Select killer and go on a rampage let our survivors screams sing to you.  Learning curve isn't too bad and it is very enjoyable once you get the hang of the mechanics.  The game has high replay value and truly is one I continuously return to play. From talking while in que around the campfire or screaming while your on a hook this is bound to keep you entertained. Will you survive or will you sacrifice all you know to the entity?
UPDATE : newest patch is just for killers , survive with friends just not fun, ill be back when re-balanced, Previously: Extremely fun with friends, one we keep coming back to play again and again.

[b]  If you have friends with you when you start playing the game, you will definitely play it for days.[/b] Then, as soon as you improve yourself in the game and start to figure out which perks do what, you realize that there is no balance  in the game and for the survivors to escape from the killer's hands, the killer must be a very bad player.[b]80% of the people who play the killer in the game have permanent damage to their brains. [/b]

After killer chase you until your teammates finish 4 generators, killer will hang you on the hook and it will take a long time for him to realize he has hung you due to brain damage. Just until you die. Meanwhile, you see the other person's illness, thank God and pray to God for his healing. And then he will remember that he had to catch the other survivors.But he will see that they have already escaped.

[b] Then he will close the game crying. No doubt he will lovingly read the poems written for him and his mother by the survivors on his steam profile and hang them on the walls of his room so that he will never forget this wonderful game he played.[/b]

Cant say you should play it now. A few years ago when i first started Playing this Game it was fun and cool, but now it has so many bugs that its horrific. The totem spawns for Killers are s*** also you need ruin to have any chance to get 1 survivor before all gens are done and the Exit Gates are opend. As survivor the hitboxes are unreal, you get hit by the Huntress with her Axes miles away and they can easaly hit you throgh pallets and windows even if you allready prossceded a full fault.
So if you want to Play DBD you are a masochist at the time so wait till they have a lot of things fixed if you car about youre Health.

Discord makes this game impossible to balance. 

(This should be no big surprise that this is coming from a killer main)

This game can be LOADS of fun, especially very early on as a killer. When you get a game of randoms who have similar skill levels to you then it can be an absolute blast. The problem comes in when you get groups of people coming in. This game was designed with limited communication as a survivor. There is no in game voice chat by design and there is no in-game text chat unless you are in a lobby. Being able to communicate outside the game allows for total victory every time as a survivor. Killer starts chasing someone, they inform their party that they are being chased and what area the killer is in, the people who aren't being chased can rush generators with impunity. Games can be done in minutes. I have gotten up to rank 2 and have only won against a pre-made group of that tier once. Its incredibly frustrating because there is little you can actually do about it. There are certain chase breakers that will reliably take up long periods of time that can't be avoided as a killer.
